panels.description: The application's last known state. An App in the Active state is ready to process messages.

targets.query: SELECT first("state") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."app" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: State

panels.description: The application's HA Role. A micro-app in the backup Role has connected to a Primary instance and is receiving replicated transactions.

targets.query: SELECT last("role") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."app" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(previous)

panels.title: Role

panels.description: The application's HA Policy. Indicates if this application is used State Replication or Event Sourcing.

targets.query: SELECT "ha_policy" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."app" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: HA Policy

panels.description: If the application's main class is annotated with an @AppVersion annotation or the jar it was loaded from contains an Implementation-Version or Specification-Version it is included here.
panels.title: Version

panels.description: The last reported CPU Usage for the Host (including other processes) as reported in the last collected XVM heartbeat.
panels.title: Running Since

panels.description: The total number of messages processed by the application since it was loaded. This counter does not include messages that were filtered.

targets.query: SELECT last("in_value") AS "Msgs In" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Messages In

panels.description: The number of Guaranteed messages this application has sourced since it was loaded. Sourced message include messages replicated from a Primary instance, recovered from a transaction log or injected by the application.

targets.query: SELECT last("in_sourced") AS "Sourced" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(previous)

panels.title: Messages Sourced

panels.description: The number of messages this application has sent since it has become Active.

targets.query: SELECT mean("events_per_commit") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."app.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Msgs Out

panels.description: The Store Object Count is useful in determining the number of objects currently held in the application's store (if it is stateful).
panels.title: Store Count

panels.description: The total serialized size of objects held in the application's store.
panels.title: Store Size (Memory)

panels.description: The total serialized size of objects held in the application's store.
panels.title: Store Size (Persisted)

panels.description: The total heap committed and used.

targets.query: SELECT last("memory_heap_committed")  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE ("vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("memory_heap_used")  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE ("vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Heap

panels.description: The total heap committed and used.

targets.query: SELECT last("memory_heap_committed")  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE ("vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("memory_heap_used")  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE ("vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Off Heap

panels.description: Shows the message receive rates in the selected time window. This chart is useful in determining if there are spikes in inbound messaging traffic or in determining if the application has stopped receiving or processing messages.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("in_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter
SELECT non_negative_derivative("filtered_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter
SELECT non_negative_derivative("count", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Messages In / Second

panels.description: Shows the message send rates in the selected time window. This chart is useful in determining if there are spikes in outbound messaging traffic or in determining if the application has stopped sending messages.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("out_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Messages Out / Second

panels.description:
This chart shows the % of the application's input queue that is used over time.

This is one of the most important indicators of an application's health: a full input queue is usually the first sign of trouble.

It means that the application is not keeping up with the inbound message load which will result in higher response latencies.

To diagnose the root cause of a temporary spike input queue usage you can zoom in such that the last selected data point in the time range is the peak of the spike, and then:

* Inspect Interval Transaction Latency stats lower on the dashboard to see if there are corresponding spikes to narrow down the cause.
  * A spike in application message processing times?
  * A spike in store commit?
  * A spike in message bus sending?
* Look at the XVM stats to see if there was a spike caused by Garbage Collection or JIT.

targets.query: SELECT (mean("capacity") - mean("remaining")) / mean("capacity") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.disruptor" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT mean("capacity") - mean("remaining") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.disruptor" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Input Queue Usage

panels.description: This stat tracks the amount of time that messages or events sit in the application's input queue awaiting processing.

targets.query: SELECT last("running_median") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

SELECT last("running_median") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

SELECT last("running_median") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Input Queue Offer To Poll

panels.description:
The number of flight transactions shows the number of transactions that have been started but have not yet been committed.

* **Store**: Committed transactions that have not be stabilized to the store (acked by quorum of backup members and/or sync'd to disk). 
* **Send**: Commited transactions with sends that have to be acknowledged by the outbound messaging bus.

targets.query: SELECT "inflight" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

SELECT last("store_commits_started") - last("store_commits_completed") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null) ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT last("send_commits_started") - last("send_commits_completed") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Transaction Pipeline

panels.description:
The times spent in application event handlers processing messages.

*Spikes or high message processing times can be indicator that performance problems lie within an application's business logic.*

targets.query: SELECT mean("median") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND "name" = 'MsgProcessing' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("max") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND "name" = 'MsgProcessing' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Message Processing Times

options.content: This sections shows application defined stats

panels.description:
Displays gauges in a tabular form. 

* Numerical stats values are reported in the *Value* column.
* Textual gauges are reported in the *String Value* column.

targets.query: SELECT last("numeric_value") AS "Numeric", last("string_value") AS "String" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.user.gauge" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 2

panels.title: App Gauges

panels.description: Displays counter stats in a tabular form.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") AS "Count" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.user.counter" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) AS "Rate" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.user.counter" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: App Counters

panels.description:
Series stats are shown with a histographical representation of the series data points collected.

*The series stats table formats all stats with microsecond units as latency collection is the most common use case for series stats.

This is because Grafana's underlying dashboards don't provide the ability to dynamically change the unit.*

targets.query: SELECT sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.user.series" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/  AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0)  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: App Series

options.content: This section lists statistics related to the application engine's transaction processing.

panels.description: Shows the transaction processing  rates in the selected time window.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("in_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Transactions / Second

panels.description:
The number of flight transactions shows the number of transactions that have been started but have not yet been committed.

* **Store**: Committed transactions that have not be stabilized to the store (acked by quorum of backup members and/or sync'd to disk). 
* **Send**: Commited transactions with sends that have to be acknowledged by the outbound messaging bus.

targets.query: SELECT "inflight" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous)

SELECT last("store_commits_started") - last("store_commits_completed") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous) ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT last("send_commits_started") - last("send_commits_completed") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(previous) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Transaction Pipeline

panels.description: The number of events per transaction. This will be greater than one only if adaptive batching has been enabled

targets.query: SELECT last("events_per_commit") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "system_name" =~ /^$system_name$/  AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Transaction Size

panels.description:
This table shows histographical latencies for the transaction pipeline over the selected time range. Zooming in to a specific time interval can help to pinpoint the cause of jitter, and mean values can help to identify throughput bottlenecks. 

* **MsgPreProc**: The time from when the message was picked up from the input queue until it was dispatched to the application. *A high value in this statistic may indicate:*
  * Message tracing costs.
  * Message filtering costs. 
* **MsgFiltering**: The time spent in message filtering providers. *A high value in this statistic may indicate:*
  * Costly Business Logic
* **MsgProcessing**: Time spent in application message handlers.* A high value in this statistic may indicate:*
  * Costly Business Logic
* **MsgSend**: The time spent inside of AepEngine sendMessage calls (this is a sub-portion of MsgProcessing). *A high value here:*
  * Does not indicate a slow message bus. Messages are only queued for delivery 
  * Could indicate costly message serialization or topic resolution.
* **MsgSendCore** Time spent in core send logic (post topic resolution and other bookkeeping)
* **CommitProlog**: Time spent from the point where transaction commit is started to when store commit starts (or send commit starts if the app has no store). *A high value in this statistic may indicate that the contents of the transaction are larger than normal.*
* **CommitStore**: The time spent from when store commit starts until store commit completes.*A high value in this statistic indicates that store commit is costly.*
  *... look into store stats to narrow down.
* **CommitTransition**: The time from which the store commit has been completed to when the send commit has started. *A high value in this statistic may indicate that:*
  * Flow control acknowledging inbound messages if acks are sent on store commit completion
  * Platform problem.
* **CommitSend**: The time from when send commit started (after store commit) to receipt of the last sent message acknowledgment. *A high value in this statistic may indicate that:*
  * No problem at all, acks can come back lazily this will vary based on the messaging implementation being used.
  * May indicate a problem if higher than other intervals.
* **CommitTransition**: The time from which the store commit has been completed to when the send commit has started. *A high value in this statistic may indicate that:*
  * Flow control acknowledging inbound messages if acks are sent on store commit completion
  * Platform problem.
* **CommitSend** The time from when send commit started (after store commit) to receipt of the last sent message acknowledgment. *A high value in this statistic may indicate that:*
  * No problem at all, acks can come back lazily this will vary based on the messaging implementation being used.
  * May indicate a problem if higher than other intervals.
* **CommitEpilogue:** The time spent completing the transaction after store commit and all messages are acked. See tleg3…
* **TransactionLeg1**: The time spent in the Engine’s Input Multiplexer Thread processing events prior to committing. Excludes time waiting for events and message processing.
* **TransactionLeg2**: The time spent handling store commit ack and releasing messages for delivery (includes CommitTransition). *A high value here may indicate:*
  * Flow control sending inbound message acks.
  * Outbound Message Logger is a bottleneck.
* **TransactionLeg3**: The time spent processing message stability events (acks), acking inbound events, doing outbound message logging and closing out the transaction, includes ‘CommitEpilogue’. *A high value here may indicate:*
  * Flow control sending inbound message acks.
  * Outbound Message Logger is a bottleneck.
* **InOut**: The time spent from the receipt of the message on the wire until it is written out. *This is a good predictor of aggregate application response time.*
* **CommitFull**: The time from when the first message in the transaction was dequeued until the transaction completes.
* **InAck**: The time from when a message was received on the wire to its being acknowledged. *A high value here can be problematic for throughput if the messaging provider uses a windowed acknowledgment protocol that pauses delivery until it receives acknowledgments.*

targets.query: SELECT sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max"  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.transaction.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND sample > 0 AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Transaction Latencies

options.content: This section shows stats related to the application's store and data files.

panels.description: The store's last reported state.

targets.query: SELECT first("state") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(none)

panels.title: State

panels.description: The store's last reported HA Role. A store in the primary role will replicate to other cluster peers that it discovers, a store in the Backup role will receive replicated transactions from the primary.

targets.query: SELECT last("role") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Role

panels.description: The store's ICR Role. When ICR is enabled, the ICR role for the store.

targets.query: SELECT last("icr_role") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: ICR Role

panels.description: Reports the number of state objects last reported as being held in the store.

targets.query: SELECT last("size") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Objects

panels.description: Reports the total size of the data in the state objects last reported as being held in the store.

targets.query: SELECT last("size") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("size") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Size

panels.description: The rate of transactions sent to backup members.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("commit_commits_sent"), 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1s) fill(none)

panels.title: Commit Sent

panels.description: The rate of transactions received from primary members.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("commit_commits_rcvd"), 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1s) fill(none)

panels.title: Commit Received

panels.description: The rate of transactions sent to backup members.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("commit_commits_sent"), 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1s) fill(none)

panels.title: Commit Rate

panels.description: This graph shows the total serialized size of all entries currently held in memory. This is also referered to as the "true" data size as it does not include java object overhead.
panels.title: Store Size (Memory)

panels.description: This graph shows both the size of the transaction log on disk and the portion of the file that is currently used. When the file is preallocated, the used size may be less than the file size.

targets.query: SELECT last("file_size") AS "File Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store.persister" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("file_size_used") AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store.persister" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Store Size (Persisted)

panels.description: The Host disk space graph shows free disk space over time for the volumes on which the application is running.

targets.query: SELECT last("disk_usable_space") AS "Usable" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system.disk" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "disk_root" fill(null)

panels.title: Host Disk Space

panels.description:
The store persister stats table shows the last reported stats for the store's transaction log:

* **﻿Commits**: ﻿The number of transaction log commits.
* **Puts**: The number of entity 'puts' recorded by the persister.
* **Updates**: The number of entity 'updates' recorded by the persister.
* **Removes**: The number of entity 'removes' recorded by the persister.
* **Sends**: The number of message 'sends' recorded by the persister. For a StateReplication application outbound message count towards this value, for EventSourcing inbound messages count towards this value.
* **File Size**: This represents the actual size of the log file currently allocated. This may differs from getFileSizeUsed() in that this value may be greater if the log has been preallocated to a larger size.
* **File Size Used**: This represents the amount of space used in the log file which may be less than the size on disk if the file has been preallocated to a larger size.

targets.query: SELECT last("commits") AS "Commits", "puts" AS "Puts", "updates" AS "Updates", "removes" AS "Removes", "sends" AS "Sends", "file_size" AS "File Size", "file_size_used" AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store.persister" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Store Persister

panels.description:
The Outbound Message Logging graph shows both the size of the transaction log on disk and the portion of the file that is currently used. 

When the file is preallocated, the used size may be less than the file size.

targets.query: SELECT last("file_size") AS "File Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.outbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("file_size_used") AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.outbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Oubound Message Log

panels.description:
The Inbound Message Logging graph shows both the size of the transaction log on disk and the portion of the file that is currently used. 

When the file is preallocated, the used size may be less than the file size.

targets.query: SELECT last("file_size") AS "File Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.inbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("file_size_used") AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.inbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Inbound Message Log

panels.description:
The Per Transaction Stats Logger graph shows both the size of the transaction log on disk and the portion of the file that is currently used. 

When the file is preallocated, the used size may be less than the file size.

targets.query: SELECT last("file_size") AS "File Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.pertransactionstats.logger" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("file_size_used") AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.pertransactionstats.logger" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Per Transaction Stats Log

panels.description:
The Outbound Message Logger's stats table shows the last reported stats for the file.

* **Commits**: The number of times the logger has been committed.
* **Messages**: The number of heartbeats logged to the file. 
* **File Size**: The size of the file in on disk. 
* **File Size Used**: The size of the file that is used (which may be less than File Size if the file was preallocated). 
*  **Average Entry Size**: The average size of entries logged.

targets.query: SELECT last("commits") AS "Commits", "messages"  AS "Messages", "file_size" AS "File Size", "file_size_used" AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.outbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("file_size_used") / last("messages")) AS "Average Entry Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.outbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Outbound Message Logger

panels.description:
The Inbound Message Logger's stats table shows the last reported stats for the file.

* **Commits**: The number of times the logger has been committed.
* **Messages**: The number of heartbeats logged to the file. 
* **File Size**: The size of the file in on disk. 
* **File Size Used**: The size of the file that is used (which may be less than File Size if the file was preallocated). 
*  **Average Entry Size**: The average size of entries logged.

targets.query: SELECT last("commits") AS "Commits", "messages" AS "Messages", "file_size" AS "File Size", "file_size_used" AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.inbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("file_size_used") / last("messages")) AS "Average Entry Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messagelogger.inbound" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Inbound Message Logger

panels.description:
The Per Transaction Stats Logger's stats table shows the last reported stats for the store's per transaction stats log.

* **Commits**: The number of times the logger has been committed.
* **Messages**: The number of heartbeats logged to the file. 
* **File Size**: The size of the file in on disk. 
* **File Size Used**: The size of the file that is used (which may be less than File Size if the file was preallocated). 
*  **Average Entry Size**: The average size of entries logged.

targets.query: SELECT last("commits") AS "Commits", "messages" AS "Messages", "file_size" AS "File Size", "file_size_used" AS "File Size Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.pertransactionstats.logger" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("file_size_used") / last("messages")) AS "Average Entry Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.pertransactionstats.logger" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Per Transaction Stats Logger

panels.description:
* **Commit**: The commit latency records the latency from commit start to the commit being stabilized to follower members and / or to disk. *Look at the other store latency stats to determine the root cause of a hight store commit time.*
* **CommitQueueSize**: The number of entries committed per commit. *While this statistic is reported with latencies, it is not actually a latency statistic but rather captures the number of entries included in a commit. For Event Sourcing, this will reflect the number of input event batched into a transaction, and for State Replication, this will reflect the number of state entries and outbound messages in the transaction.
* **Deserialize**: The time spent deserializing each message or state change entry *A high value here may indicate*:
  * A large object was received.
  * Inefficient object encoding.
* **Persist**: The time spent persisting each entry to disk. *A high value here indicates backpressure due to a disk bottleneck.*
* **Serialize**: The time spent serializing each message or state change entry *A high value here may indicate:*
  * Large object sizes.
  * Inefficient object encoding.
* **SerializeToPersist**: The time spent between writing each entry to the wire to it being enqueued in the persister. *A high value here may indicate network congestion writing the entry to the wire*
* **SerializeToWire**: 
  * *For a Primary*: The time spent after serialization of each entry to the point just before the entry is written to the wire. *A high value here may indicate:*
    * Connectivity issues to backup instances. 
    * Platform overhead. 
  * *For a Backup*: The time spent from the time the last entries were persisted until just before the commit ack is written to the wire. 
*A high value here may indicate:*
    * Network congestion writing the entry to the wire
    * Platform overhead.'
* **Wire**: The time from the first store commit entry being written to the wire to receipt of the store ack. *A high value here indicates*
  * A slow replication network. 
  * A bottleneck on the backup(s)

  **For a backup this value is subject to clock skew!** 
* **Wire**: The time from the first store commit entry being written to the wire to receipt of the store ack. *A high value here indicates*
  * A slow replication network. 
  * A bottleneck on the backup(s)
* **WIreToDeserialize**: The time from when a commit entry (or, on primary, an ack) is received on the wire until it is deserialized. *A high value here may indicate platform overhead or a tuning issue*.

targets.query: SELECT sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Store Latencies

options.content:
This section shows stats that are captured on a per message type basis (when they are enabled and collected). Per message type stats provide a finer-grained view of stats broken down by message type. To reduce heartbeat overhead, per message type stats collection is disabled by default. When they are enabled, a subset of transaction processing stats is captured on a per message basis. Those that are collected, are displayed in this section of the dashboard.
See Also: Enabling Message Type Specific Stats

panels.description: Each message's inbound rate is also plotted which provides a quick overview of message ingress over time.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("in_value") AS "In" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("in_best_effort" > 0 OR "in_guaranteed" > 0  OR "in_filtered" > 0  OR "in_sourced" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id"

panels.title: Inbound Message Rates

panels.description: This panel plots message processing time over time and is useful for detecting spikes or trends in message processing as time progresses

targets.query: SELECT "median" AS "Median", "max" AS "Max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" fill(null)  ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Processing Latencies

panels.description:
The inbound messages table shows the current counts and rates by each message type. This can be used to break down the rates reported in the overview panel's single stats.

*The message counts reported in the table show both the running total since the application was loaded, and the counts within the selected time interval. The latter counts use the (int) suffix.* 

* **Message Type**: The simple class name of the message suffixed by its factory id, and type id. 
* **In**: The total number of messages processed by the application since it was loaded. This counter does not include messages that were filtered.
* **Received**: The number of live messages this application has received from a message bus since it has become Active
* **Sourced**: The number of messages this application has sourced since it was loaded. Sourced message include messages replicated from a Primary instance, recovered from a transaction log or injected by the application.
* **Filtered**: The number of messages this application has filtered via a Message Filter. statistic since it was loaded.
* **Duplicates**: The number of duplicate messages the application has received since it was loaded.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", "msg_id" AS "Message Type" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter AND ("in_best_effort" > 0 OR  "in_guaranteed"  > 0 OR  "in_sourced" > 0 OR "in_filtered"  > 0 OR "in_dups" > 0 OR "median" > 0) GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("in_best_effort") + last("in_guaranteed") + last("in_sourced")) AS "In", (last("in_best_effort") - min("in_best_effort")  + last("in_guaranteed")  - min("in_guaranteed") + last("in_sourced") -min("in_sourced")) AS "in (int)" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("in_best_effort") + last("in_guaranteed")) AS "(Received)", (last("in_guaranteed") - min("in_guaranteed") + last("in_best_effort") - min("in_best_effort")) AS "(Received (int))" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT last("in_sourced") AS "(Sourced)", (last("in_sourced") - min("in_sourced")) AS "(Sourced (int))" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT last("in_filtered")  AS "Filtered", (last("in_filtered") - min("in_filtered")) AS "Filtered (int)" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT last("in_dups") AS "Dups",  (last("in_dups") - min("in_dups")) AS "Dups (int)"  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Inbound Messages

panels.description:
This table shows the time from when a message was created to when it was queued for processing by the engine. 

The creation timestamp is dependent on the source of the messsage: 
* For a message received from a message bus the creation time is the time at which the message was deserialized by the message bus binding. 
* For a message injected into the engine it is the time at which the the application created the message. 
* For a message recovered from a transaction log or received by a backup instance via cluster replication it is the time at which the message was materialized into a message view. 

Stats:

* **Sample**: The number of messages over which the data is aggregated. If 'Skipped' is 0 then all messages received during the selected time window are included in the histogram.
* **Skipped**: If the message rate is higher than the XVMs sampling frequency, the cyclical buffer used to hold sampled data can wrap causing some collected points to be excluded for the histogram. This counter reflects how many points were skipped due to under sampling.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "name" =~ /CreateToOffer/ AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Create To Offer Times

panels.description:
This table shows the time amount of time that messages spent in the engine's input queue. 

* **Sample**: The number of messages over which the data is aggregated. If 'Skipped' is 0 then all messages received during the selected time window are included in the histogram.
* **Skipped**: If the message rate is higher than the XVMs sampling frequency, the cyclical buffer used to hold sampled data can wrap causing some collected points to be excluded for the histogram. This counter reflects how many points were skipped due to under sampling.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "name" =~ /OfferToPoll/ AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Queueing Times

panels.description:
This table shows the time from when a message was created to when it was queued for processing by the engine. 

The creation timestamp is dependent on the source of the messsage: 
* For a message received from a message bus the creation time is the time at which the message was deserialized by the message bus binding. 
* For a message injected into the engine it is the time at which the the application created the message. 
* For a message recovered from a transaction log or received by a backup instance via cluster replication it is the time at which the message was materialized into a message view. 

Stats:

* **Sample**: The number of messages over which the data is aggregated. If 'Skipped' is 0 then all messages received during the selected time window are included in the histogram.
* **Skipped**: If the message rate is higher than the XVMs sampling frequency, the cyclical buffer used to hold sampled data can wrap causing some collected points to be excluded for the histogram. This counter reflects how many points were skipped due to under sampling.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "name" =~ /CreateToOffer/ AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Create To Offer Times

panels.description:
This table shows the histographical break down of message processing times aggregate over the selected time interval. 

* **Sample**: The number of messages over which the data is aggregated. If 'Skipped' is 0 then all messages received during the selected time window are included in the histogram.
* **Skipped**: If the message rate is higher than the XVMs sampling frequency, the cyclical buffer used to hold sampled data can wrap causing some collected points to be excluded for the histogram. This counter reflects how many points were skipped due to under sampling.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "name" =~ /MsgPreProc/ AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Pre Processing Times

panels.description:
This table shows the histographical break down of message processing times aggregate over the selected time interval. 

* **Sample**: The number of messages over which the data is aggregated. If 'Skipped' is 0 then all messages received during the selected time window are included in the histogram.
* **Skipped**: If the message rate is higher than the XVMs sampling frequency, the cyclical buffer used to hold sampled data can wrap causing some collected points to be excluded for the histogram. This counter reflects how many points were skipped due to under sampling.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "name" =~ /MsgProcessing/ AND ("running_sample" > 0 OR "sample" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Message Processing Times

panels.description: Each message's outbound rate is also plotted which provides a quick overview of message egress over time.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("out_value") AS "Sent/Sec" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("out_best_effort" > 0 OR "out_guaranteed" > 0) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id"

panels.title: Outbound Message Rates

panels.description:
This table shows the current counts and rates by each message type. This can be used to break down the rates reported in the overview panel's single stats.

*The message counts reported in the table show both the running total since the application was loaded, and the counts within the selected time interval. The latter counts use the (int) suffix.* 

* **Sent**: The number of messages of this type that were sent by the application. 
* **Resent**: The number of messages of this type that were retransmitted.

targets.query: SELECT last("msg_name") AS "Message Name", "msg_id" AS "Message Type" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter AND ("out_best_effort"  > 0 OR  "out_guaranteed" > 0 OR "out_resent"  > 0) GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT (last("out_best_effort") + last("out_guaranteed")) AS "Sent",  ((last("out_best_effort") - min("out_best_effort")) + (last("out_guaranteed") - min("out_guaranteed"))) AS "Sent (int)" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT last("out_resent") AS "Resent", (last("out_resent") - min("out_resent")) AS "Resent (int)" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages.type" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "msg_id" ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

panels.title: Outbound Messages

options.content: This section shows stats related to the application's '$bus_name' bus

panels.description: The number of messages sent through the bus.

targets.query: SELECT last("msgs_rcvd") AS "Msgs Rcvd" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(previous)

panels.title: Msgs Sent

panels.description: The number of acks received for guaranteed messages sent through the bus.

targets.query: SELECT last("msgs_rcvd") AS "Msgs Rcvd" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(previous)

panels.title: Acks (Stability) Received)

panels.description: The number of messages received via this bus.

targets.query: SELECT last("msgs_rcvd") AS "Msgs Rcvd" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(previous)

panels.title: Msgs Rcvd

panels.description: The number of acks sent back through the bus for guaranteed messages received from it.

targets.query: SELECT last("acks_sent") AS "Acks Sent" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Acks Sent

panels.description: The number of transactions commits for the bus.

targets.query: SELECT last("acks_sent") AS "Acks Sent" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Commits

panels.description: The number of failures that have occured for the bus.

targets.query: SELECT last("acks_sent") AS "Acks Sent" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Failures

panels.description: This graph shows the message send and receive rates through the bus for the selected time interval

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("filtered_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter
SELECT non_negative_derivative("filtered_value", 1s) FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Messages Rates

panels.description:
When the bus is configured for detached sends, this graph shows the disruptor usage over time. 

*High disruptor usage for the bus indicates that the bus is congested.*

targets.query: SELECT (mean("capacity") - min("remaining")) / mean("capacity") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor" WHERE "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "bus_name" =~ /^$bus_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Detached Send Disruptor Usage

panels.description: When the bus is configured for detached sends, this graph shows the amount of time message spend on the sender thread's input queue waiting to be sent.

targets.query: SELECT median("median") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND  "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("bus_name" =~ /^$bus_name$/ OR "bus_name" !~ /./ ) AND "name" = 'OfferToPoll' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

SELECT mean("mean") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND  "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("bus_name" =~ /^$bus_name$/ OR "bus_name" !~ /./ ) AND "name" = 'OfferToPoll' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

SELECT max("pct99") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND  "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("bus_name" =~ /^$bus_name$/ OR "bus_name" !~ /./ ) AND "name" = 'OfferToPoll' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

SELECT max("max") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.disruptor.latencies" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND  "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND ("bus_name" =~ /^$bus_name$/ OR "bus_name" !~ /./ ) AND "name" = 'OfferToPoll' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

panels.title: Detached Send Offer To Poll

panels.description:
**Inbound Message Latency Stats**
* **Wire**: The time just before the message was written to the wire by sending application to time just after receipt

  **This value is subject to clock skew!**
  
  On the receiver side this value is computed from the time the message provider API passes the message to the platform (it includes time spent in message provider apis), *A higher time relative to other intervals may indicate message bus or network latency issues.*
* **WireToDeserialize**: The time spent in the message provider prior to the message being materialized in object form. *A high value here indicates that there are delays in the bus binding code path prior to deserialization (e.g.provider specific bus binding logic)*
* **Deserialize**: The time spent deserializing the message into an object. *A high value here may indicate inefficient encoding or large / complex messages.*
* **DeserializeToReceive**: The time from when serialization completes to just before the message is written to the wire or provider send API. *A high value here generally indicates that the message sat in the application’s input queue.*
* **Origin2Receive**: The time spent from the point the message was created on the sender side to being received by the application for processing. 

  **This value is subject to clock skew!**

  *A high value here could be caused by any of the send / receive path before this.
Requires message bus binding support for propagating origin timestamp.*

---

**Outbound Message Latency Stats**
* **CreateToSend**: The time from when the message was created until it was 'offered' to the bus binding for send. *A high value in this statistic may be indicative of:*
  * significant time spent populating the message.
  * significant business logic before the message was sent
  * a delay in replication prior to committing the message. 
* **SendToSerialize**: The time spent from the point at which the message is 'offered' to the binding for send until just before the binding is serialized into the underlying transport. *A high value here indicates that there are delays in the bus binding code path prior to serialization (e.g. binding is busy serializing / sending previous messages.*
* **Serialize**: The time spent serializing the MessageView to its transport encoding. *A high value here indicates that message may be using an inefficient encoding or that messages are large or complex.*
* **SerializeToWire**: The time from when serialization completes to just before the message is written to the wire or provider send API. *A high value here usually indicates overhead in the bus binding implementation.*
* **WireSend (ws)**: The time spent in the provider send call and/or writing to the network. *A high value here indicates that there are delays in the bus binding code path prior to serialization (e.g. binding is busy serializing / sending previous messages.*

targets.query: SELECT sum("sample") AS "Sample", (last("skipped") - min("skipped")) AS "Skipped", median("median") AS "median", mean("mean") AS "mean", min("min") AS "min", mean("pct75") AS "75%ile", mean("pct90") AS "90%ile", mean("pct99") AS "99%ile", mean("pct999") AS "99.9%ile", mean("pct9999") AS "99.99%ile", max("max") AS "max"  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus.latencies" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND "bus_name" =~ /$bus_name$/ AND $timeFilter  GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Messaging Latencies

options.content:
This section shows memory related stats for the application.

Note: Pool and Memory usage are technically JVM wide stats, and typically affect all applications in the JVM. They are shown here for correlation purposes.

panels.description:
This graph shows the heap memory usage for the process as reported by the last heartbeat received from the XVM.

* **Heap Used**: The amount of heap memory currently used by the application. 
* **Heap Init**: The amount of heap memory that the Java virtual machine initially requested from the operating system.
* **Heap Committed**: The amount of heap memory guaranteed (committed) for the Java virtual machine to use.
* **Heap Max**: The maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for heap memory management.

  This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available for memory management if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

  A value of -1 indicates that the maximum memory size is undefined.

*The values shown are current to the last reported heartbeat collected by this XVM. If no heartbeats have been reported in the selected time interval, then no data will be shown.*

targets.query: SELECT "memory_heap_used" as "Heap Used",  "memory_heap_init" as "Heap Init", "memory_heap_committed" as "Heap Committed",  "memory_heap_max" as "Heap Max"  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Heap Memory Usage

panels.description:
This graph shows the off-heap memory usage for the process as reported by the last heartbeat received from this XVM.

* **Off-Heap Used**: The amount of off-heap memory used by the process in which the application is running. 
* **Off-Heap Init**: The amount of off-heap memory that the Java virtual machine initially requests from the operating system.
* **Off-Heap Committed**: This amount of off-heap memory guaranteed (committed) for the Java virtual machine to use.
* **Off-Heap Max**: The maximum amount memory in bytes that can be used for off-heap memory management.

  This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available for memory management if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

  A value of -1 indicates that the maximum memory size is undefined.

*The values shown are current to the last reported heartbeat collected by this XVM. If no heartbeats have been reported in the selected time interval, then no data will be shown.*

targets.query: SELECT  "memory_non_heap_used" as "Off Heap Used",  "memory_non_heap_init" as "Off Heap Init", "memory_non_heap_committed" as "Off Heap Committed",  "memory_non_heap_max" as "Off Heap Max"  FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Non Heap Memory Usage

panels.description:
This graph shows the off-heap memory usage for the process as reported by the last heartbeat received from this XVM.

* **Bytes Live (Native)**: The amount of live off-heap memory that the process has directly allocated as native memory blocks. 
* **Bytes Live (IOBuf)**: The amount of live off-heap memory that the process is using via allocated IO Buffers. 
* **Bytes Pooled**: This amount of off-heap memory pooled/cached for future use.

targets.query: SELECT  "memory_off_heap_pooled" as "Bytes Pooled (Total)", "memory_off_heap_live" as "Bytes Live (Total)",  "memory_iobuf_bytes_pooled" as "Bytes Pooled (IOBuf)", "memory_native_bytes_live" as "Bytes Live (Native)", "memory_iobuf_bytes_live" as "Bytes Live (IOBuf)" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Off Heap Memory Usage

panels.description:
This graph shows overall memory usage for the host on which this XVM is running as reported by the last heartbeat received from this XVM. 

* **Host Used**: The total amount of physical memory currently in use on the host. 
* **Host Total**: The total amount of physical memory on the host. 

*The values shown are current to the last reported heartbeat collected by this XVM. If no heartbeats have been reported in the selected time interval, then no data will be shown.*

targets.query: SELECT (last("memory_physical_size_total") - last("memory_physical_size_free")) AS "Host Used" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("memory_physical_size_total") AS "Host Total" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Host Memory

targets.query: SELECT last("memory_entity_serializer_count_pooled") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system" WHERE ("vm_name"::tag =~ /^$vm_name$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT last("short_name") as "Name", last("memory_entity_count_live") AS "Live", last("memory_entity_count_pooled") AS "Pooled", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_live") AS "P-Live", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_pooled") AS "P-Pooled", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_live") AS "S-Live", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_pooled") AS "S-Pooled", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_live") AS "D-Live", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_pooled") AS "D-Pooled", last("memory_entity_data_count_live") AS "Da Live Count", last("memory_entity_data_bytes_live") AS "Da Live Bytes" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system.entity_memory" WHERE "type"='embedded_entity' AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT last("short_name") as "Name", last("memory_entity_count_live") AS "Live", last("memory_entity_count_pooled") AS "Pooled", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_live") AS "P-Live", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_pooled") AS "P-Pooled", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_live") AS "S-Live", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_pooled") AS "S-Pooled", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_live") AS "D-Live", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_pooled") AS "D-Pooled", last("memory_entity_data_count_live") AS "Da Live Count", last("memory_entity_data_bytes_live") AS "Da Live Bytes" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system.entity_memory" WHERE "type"='state_entity' AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT last("short_name") as "Name", last("memory_entity_count_live") AS "Live", last("memory_entity_count_pooled") AS "Pooled", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_live") AS "P-Live", last("memory_entity_pojo_count_pooled") AS "P-Pooled", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_live") AS "S-Live", last("memory_entity_serializer_count_pooled") AS "S-Pooled", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_live") AS "D-Live", last("memory_entity_deserializer_count_pooled") AS "D-Pooled", last("memory_entity_data_count_live") AS "Da Live Count", last("memory_entity_data_bytes_live") AS "Da Live Bytes" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system.entity_memory" WHERE "type"='message' AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.description: This graph plots the rate of heap memory allocation over time.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("in_value", 1s) AS "Inbound", non_negative_derivative("out_value", 1s)  AS "Outbound" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Heap Allocation Rate

panels.description:
Shows garbage collection duration grouped by the collector type.

The graph renders the delta of the total time spent collecting by each collector as reported in successive intervals ... if more than one collection occurs within a heartbeat collection interval their combined collection time will be shown.

targets.query: SELECT difference("cum_time") FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."system.gc" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "collector_name" fill(none)

panels.title: Garbage Collector

panels.description: Shows the inbound and outbound rates in the selected time window. This chart is useful in determining if memory usage patterns are correlated to message flow.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("in_value", 1s) AS "Inbound", non_negative_derivative("out_value", 1s)  AS "Outbound" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.messages" WHERE "app_name" =~ /$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Messaging Rates

panels.description: Plots the store size over the selected time window. This chart is useful in determining if memory usage patterns correlate to growth in application state.

targets.query: SELECT "data_size" AS "Data Size" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter
SELECT "size" AS "Object Count" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.store" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "app_name" =~ /^$app_name$/ AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Store Size

panels.description:
* **Pool Name﻿**: The unique name of the pool within the JVM. 
* **Puts**﻿: The number of objects added or returned to the pool.
* **Gets**: The number of objects obtained from the pool.
﻿* **Misses**: ﻿The number of pool 'gets' that caused a new object to be allocated.
  * A positive value here indicates a pool leak which a cause for concern of a zero garbage application. 
* **Hits**: The number of pool 'gets' that found an available object from the pool (either preallocated or a previously returned object).
* **Growths**: The number of times the pool's capacity was increased to accommodate objects 'put' into the pool.
* **Evicts**: The number of objects that were not 'put' into the pool because the pool had insufficient capacity.
* **Washes**: The number of objects that were re-initialized in a detached thread. 
* **Size**: ﻿The last reported count of objects in the pool that are available for a caller to 'get' without a miss. 
  * *A value of 0 here is not a cause for concern, healthy pools will frequently have a low count of unused objects.*
* **﻿Preallocated**: ﻿The last reported number of preallocated objects remaining in the pool.
* **Capacity**: ﻿The last reported size of the backing array used to hold objects that are currently not in use. A pool's capacity may grow over time to accommodate holding batches of objects returned to the pool. 
---
Note that stats for a given pool are not reported on every heartbeat. Pool stats are currently only reported when the following occurs:

* There was a 'miss' during the heartbeat collection interval. 
* The pool's preallocated capacity fell below a reporting threshold. 
* The pool's Size hit a new high water mark. 
* The pool's Capacity was increased. 

*This means that for any given time window, the pool stats shown in this table will be limited to pools for which any of the above criteria were met.*

targets.query: SELECT (last("puts") -min("puts")) AS "Puts", (last("gets") - min("gets")) AS "Gets", (last("misses") - min("misses")) AS "Misses", (last("hits") - min("hits")) AS "Hits", (last("growths") - min("growths")) AS "Growths", (last("evicts") - min("evicts")) AS "Evicts", (last("detached_washes") - min("detached_washes")) AS "Washes", last("size") AS "Size", last("preallocated") AS "Preallocated", last("capacity") AS "Capacity" FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."pools" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name" ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Pool Stats

list.label: System
list.name: system_name
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application" WITH KEY = "system_name"

list.label: VM
list.name: vm_name
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application" WITH KEY = "vm_name" WHERE "system_name" =~ /^$system_name$/

list.label: Application
list.name: app_name
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application" WITH KEY = "app_name" WHERE "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/ AND "system_name" =~ /^$system_name$/

list.label: Buses
list.name: bus_name
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lumino_heartbeat_rp"."application.bus" WITH KEY = "bus_name" WHERE app_name =~ /^$app_name$/ AND "vm_name" =~ /^$vm_name$/
